intro: Brachtia diphylla, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The plant has a rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, daisy-like blooms. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal areas. Brachtia diphylla is also known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, demonstrating its adaptability to harsh environments.
